headline: Assessing NextDecade (NEXT) Valuation As LNG Market Shifts Toward Non Russian Supply
summary: NextDecade stock reacts to LNG market shift NextDecade (NEXT) is back on investors’ radar after Europe’s move away from Russian natural gas and the timing of its Rio Grande LNG project, which is backed by long term offtake deals with TotalEnergies and Exxon. See our latest analysis for NextDecade. The recent 4.1% 1 day share price return to US$5.29 comes after a weaker patch, with a 30 day share price return of 3.5% decline and a 1 year total shareholder return of 41.6% decline. headline: Nvidia's place in AI, Apple downgrade, JPMorgan cautious on oil
summary: Market Domination Host Josh Lipton and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma track several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Nvidia's (NVDA) position in the AI ecosystem, Citi analysts cutting their price target on Apple (AAPL), and JPMorgan's cautious outlook on the oil industry (CL=F, BZ=F). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Exxon Mobil, Altria, and Other Defensive Dividend Stocks for a Rocky Market
summary: President Donald Trump’s threats over Greenland are rattling the stock market.  Fears of new political tension over the White House’s aggressive foreign policy and his demands to buy Greenland sent the  down 2% on Tuesday.  For stock market investors—who were already worried about a shaky U.S. economy and runaway artificial-intelligence spending—it’s yet another red flag.

headline: Exclusive-Kazakhstan's Tengiz oilfield to stay shut for another 7-10 days, sources say
summary: MOSCOW, Jan 20 () - Oil production at Kazakhstan's vast Tengiz oilfield, one of the world's largest, could be halted for another 7-10 days after shutting down on Sunday, cutting crude exports via the Caspian Pipeline ​Consortium, three industry sources told . Operator Tengizchevroil (TCO) said on Monday that production at the Tengiz and Korolevskoye fields had been ‌stopped because of power supply problems.
